sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"抛，投，掷"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: throw, cast, fling, heave, hurl, pitch, toss
means: throw ： 普通用词，使用广泛，仅指用力抛掷，不涉及动作方式或感情色彩。
cast常可与throw互换，指迅速扔出一个重量较轻的物体。
fling ： 指用力投掷，或因感情激动而粗暴地或漫无目的地扔东西。
heave ： 指把重物举起后扔出。
hurl ： 通常指用力投掷，动作迅猛，所投掷的距离也较远。
pitch ： 指随意地、轻轻地掷或扔，侧重方向性和有明确的目标。
toss ： 指无什么目的地、轻轻地、随意地掷或扔，所扔掷的东西一般都比较轻。

word_mean: 管型：某样物体的阴模复制品，封闭空间的固体样复制品，例如在空腔器官(肾小管，细支气管等)的模型物，可由其中渗出的可塑性物质形成，并排出体外，例如尿管型
模型：一种物体的精确复制品或拷贝，它是用可塑性物质在印模或铸模中造成
铸造：用铸模制作一物体
硬质的敷料：此敷料于柔韧时做成身体的模型，干时变硬，以给予坚固的支持
牙模：上颌或下颌弓或其一部分的正性复制品，它是由上或下颌弓的印模制成的，又称model
管型：A.尿中鳞状上皮（上半部）及上皮管型（上半部）

种姓制度：施行至今长达三千多年的种姓制度（Caste），是印度社会的一大特色，印度人从姓氏就可知彼此的种姓层级。
种姓（Caste）是印度教社会特有的等级制度，这一制度从理论上把人划分为四个高低不同的等级：婆罗门（Brahmin，神职人员）、 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Norse kasta 'to cast or throw'
mid 17th cent.: a special use of cast in sense 4 of the verb

entry.def: The cast of a play or film is all the people who act in it.

example.ex: The show is very amusing and the cast are very good.
example.tran: 演出妙趣横生，演员的表演也很出彩。

entry.tran: 挑选(演员);使…出演(某角色)
entry.def: To cast an actor in a play or film means to choose them to act a particular role in it.

example.ex: The world premiere of Harold Pinter's new play casts Ian Holm in the lead role...
example.tran: 哈罗德·品特新剧的世界首演由伊恩·霍尔姆担纲主演。

example.ex: He was cast as a college professor...
example.tran: 他被安排饰演一个大学教授。

entry.def: To cast someone in a particular way or as a particular thing means to describe them in that way or suggest they are that thing.

example.ex: Democrats have been worried about being cast as the party of the poor...
example.tran: 民主党人一直担心被描绘成穷人的政党。

example.ex: Holland would never dare cast himself as a virtuoso pianist.
example.tran: 霍兰永远不敢说自己是位钢琴名家。

entry.def: If you cast your eyes or cast a look in a particular direction, you look quickly in that direction.

example.ex: He cast a stern glance at the two men...
example.tran: 他朝那两个人狠狠地瞪了一眼。

example.ex: I cast my eyes down briefly...

entry.def: If something casts a light or shadow somewhere, it causes it to appear there.

example.ex: The moon cast a bright light over the yard...
example.tran: 明亮的月光洒在院子里。

example.ex: They flew in over the beach, casting a huge shadow.
example.tran: 它们飞到海滩上空，抛下一大片黑影。

entry.def: To cast doubt on something means to cause people to be unsure about it.

example.ex: Last night a top criminal psychologist cast doubt on the theory.
example.tran: 昨天晚上，一位顶级犯罪心理学家使人们对该理论产生了怀疑。

entry.def: When you cast your vote in an election, you vote.

example.ex: About ninety-five per cent of those who cast their votes approve the new constitution...
example.tran: 参加投票的人中有大约95%支持新宪法。

example.ex: Gaviria had been widely expected to obtain well over half the votes cast.
example.tran: 人们普遍认为加维里亚能获得远远超过半数的选票。

entry.def: To cast something or someone somewhere means to throw them there.

example.ex: Any true lover casting a pin into the fountain and gazing into it will see his or her future partner...
example.tran: 只要你心诚，往喷泉里扔下一根大头针，然后盯着泉水看，就能看见未来伴侣的影子。

example.ex: John had Maude and her son cast into a dungeon.
example.tran: 约翰让人将莫德和她的儿子关进了地牢。

entry.def: If someone casts a fishing line or casts, they throw one end of the fishing line into the water.

example.ex: Some way from them, the fisherman cast his line.
example.tran: 在离他们稍远的地方，渔夫下了钩。

entry.def: To cast an object means to make it by pouring a liquid such as hot metal into a specially shaped container and leaving it there until it becomes hard.
A cast is a model that has been made by pouring a liquid such as plaster or hot metal onto something or into something, so that when it hardens it has the same shape as that thing.

example.ex: An orthodontist took a cast of the inside of Billy's mouth.
example.tran: 正畸医生从比利的口腔内部取了模型。

entry.def: A cast is the same as a plaster cast .
If someone has a particular cast of mind or cast of thought, they have that kind of character or way of thinking of things.

example.ex: The Social Democratic Party was full of people of an academic cast of mind...
example.tran: 社会民主党内尽是些学究式思维的人。

example.ex: Hers was an essentially sunny cast of mind.
example.tran: 她本质上是属于阳光快乐的性格。

means.word_mean: 2. container into which liquid is poured to create a given shape when it hardens
3. the distinctive form in which a thing is made;

sentences.sentence: "pottery of this cast was found throughout the region"

means.word_mean: 4. the visual appearance of something or someone;
5. bandage consisting of a firm covering (often made of plaster of Paris) that immobilizes broken bones while they heal
8. the act of throwing a fishing line out over the water by means of a rod and reel

sentences.sentence: "She threw the flashlight beam into the corner"

means.word_mean: 3. select to play,sing, or dance a part in a play, movie, musical, opera, or ballet;

sentences.sentence: "He cast a young woman in the role of Desdemona"

means.word_mean: 5. assign the roles of (a movie or a play) to actors;
6. move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment;

sentences.sentence: "the laborers drift from one town to the next"

means.word_mean: 7. form by pouring (e.g., wax or hot metal) into a cast or mold;

sentences.sentence: "he shed his image as a pushy boss"

means.word_mean: 10. formulate in a particular style or language;

sentences.sentence: "She cast her request in very polite language"

means.word_mean: 11. eject the contents of the stomach through the mouth;

sentences.sentence: "After drinking too much, the students vomited"
"The patient regurgitated the food we gave him last night"

means.word_mean: 1. (of molten metal or glass) formed by pouring or pressing into a mold

sentences.en: This is a good place to cast.
sentences.cn: 这是垂钓的好地方。

sentences.en: Iron casts better than copper.
sentences.cn: 铁比铜好铸造些。

sentences.en: Bronze are now cast into coins.
sentences.cn: 青铜被铸成了钱币。

sentences.en: She cast him a significant smile.
sentences.cn: 她向他投去意味深长的一笑。

sentences.en: He was cast as[for the part of] Hamlet.
sentences.cn: 选派他扮演哈姆雷特的角色。

sentences.en: The boy cast a stone into the water.
sentences.cn: 男孩把一块石头扔进水中。

sentences.en: The statue was cast in bronze.
sentences.cn: 这座塑像是用青铜铸成的。

sentences.en: He cast his fishing line into the lake every evening.
sentences.cn: 他每天傍晚在湖边钓鱼。

sentences.en: The cow cast a calf.
sentences.cn: 这头母牛早产了。

sentences.en: He cast aside all his old friends when he became rich.
sentences.cn: 他发了财就把所有的老朋友都抛弃了。

sentences.en: The peach trees cast all their blossoms after the heavy rain.
sentences.cn: 大雨过后，桃花全部落掉。

sentences.en: You must cast up this column of figures carefully.
sentences.cn: 你必须认真地将这一栏数字加在一起。

sentences.en: The old man cast my fortune.
sentences.cn: 这位老人给我算命。

sentences.en: They cast their plan in great detail.
sentences.cn: 他们非常具体地制订了计划。

means.word_mean: 投, 掷, 抛, 扔

sentences.en: He made a cast with a fishing line.
sentences.cn: 他抛下了鱼线。

sentences.en: She made a plaster cast of a bust of Lincoln.
sentences.cn: 她用石膏塑造了一座林肯半身像。

sentences.en: He's got his leg in a plaster cast.
sentences.cn: 他的腿打了石膏。

sentences.en: The cast is[are] waiting on the stage.
sentences.cn: 全体演员正在舞台上等候。

sentences.en: He is sick and has been casting up all night.
sentences.cn: 他病了，夜里一直在呕吐。

sentences.en: Lumber casts.
sentences.cn: 木料会变形扭曲。
